Driver

Class ATM

extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Gergely A00976672 Assignment 3

    • Constructor Detail

      • ATM

        public ATM()
        Default constructor. Calls the initialize() method to seed the Bank with some BankCustomers. Calls the run() method to perform the primary program functions.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method calls the class default constructor.
        Parameters:
        args - for program arguments (not used)

      • run

        public void run()
        The primary application processor. All application functions are called from here. Starts by seeding the Bank class HashMap with BankCustomers, and display a menu of choices. Uses a loop to prompt users to perform banking transactions. Must use switch/case selection to determine uses choices.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Adds Customer references to the Bank HashMap as seed data for testing.

      • transactDeposit

        public void transactDeposit()
        Performs a deposit into a BankCustomer's account. Checks to see if the user has signed in. If not, then verifyCustomer() is called and the menu is displayed again.

      • transactWithdraw

        public void transactWithdraw()
        Performs a withdrawal from a BankCustomer's account. Checks to see if the user has signed in. If not, then verifyCustomer() is called and the menu is displayed again.

      • displayAccountInformation

        public void displayAccountInformation()
        Performs a withdrawal from a BankCustomer's account. Checks to see if the user has signed in. If not, then verifyCustomer() is called and the menu is displayed again.

      • verifyCustomer

        public void verifyCustomer()
        To confirm a BankCustomer's account number and passcode. Called when the user is required to sign in to the application. Will set a boolean so the user does not have to sign in again during the session.

      • shutDown

        public void shutDown()
        Displays the final information for the current account along with the account transaction history. Then displays all the account data for all bank customer and terminates the program run.
